comments.body:
```
scala> java.util.Objects.equals(null, "")
res0: Boolean = false
```

so wouldn't this return different result for `null`?

Yeah, but `parent` never is `null`, so I dropped that first.

But the thing here is equals vs `==`, in Java, where `==` means reference equality.  I _assume_/hope there's only 1 `""`, or at least for the literal `""`, within a JVM execution, but I wasn't sure so went with the safer option.

WDYT?

You're right on this one.

```
eval new String("") eq ""
<eval>:1: warning: comparing a fresh object using `eq' will always yield false
new String("") eq ""
               ^
[info] ans: Boolean = false
```
